page.title: 07N. Lopham Annual Fete
page.content: At the village fete in June, held at the Lophams' Village Hall, there was 5_a_side football and some clay pigeon shooting. We had races, e.g. mini marathon, tug of war, egg and spoon, flat race, football slalom. There was money for first, second and third _ 15p for first, 10p for second and 5p for third. In the hall were cake stalls and tea stalls. There were lots of games stalls, such as skittles, a netball game and a bean bag game. The bottle stall was good. Each bottle had a number and you bought a ticket that matched the number on the bottle and you won a bottle of something. It was 20p a ticket. The highlight of the day was when David Bellamy came. He pulled out some raffle tickets and he gave some people his autograph.
